quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Are you swallowing them whole?  You're eating them so fast, are they even touching your tongue?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [with mouth full] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Brownies is it? Hm. Pastry cubes made of sugar and fat? No thank you, I'll stick with my jerkie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So why did you come in here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: To socialize.  And inform.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh brownies! I'm taking two so I can parcel them up and eat them at my leisure later on, much healthier.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: You're taking two?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah, um, but one of them is for Toby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah why don't you send that to him in Costa Rica?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Um, I'm just gonna hand it to him right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Heh, okay, weirdo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Why is that, why is that weird?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: She said she was going to give it to him right now. [starts laughing]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [laughing] She's probably going to, cause they sit next to each other.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, they used to.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Toby works here again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, can you imagine?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uhhgh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You don't know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't know.  What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You should probably just meander back there; take a look.  See if he's, see if he's back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hmmm, dare I? [laughs]  You know what? I'm going to, for old time's sake.  [walks to the annex, standing in Toby's cubicle] Great practical joke Jim, you got me to go to the annex. [turns around and sees Toby]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hi, Micha-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: NOOOO! GOD! No, God, please no! No! No! NOOO!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [watching Toby at Phyllis' desk through his office blinds] Look at him.  With his stupid face.  Stupid... tan. No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He looks great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well rested.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: He looks worse.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Michael, is everyone okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh, well I'm afraid not.  Toby Flenderson, of H.R., has made a sudden reappearance.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: I don't understand, is anyone hurt?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Not on the surface, no, but I can tell people are disturbed, David.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Michael, you texted me, 911 CALL ME.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: All in caps.  Do you know what 911 means?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I learned a while back that if I don't text 911 people will not return my calls.   Um, but now people always return my calls because they think that something horrible has happened.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Now what I'm curious about is how you were able to go an entire a week without knowing a member of your staff was there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I did not want to go back to the annex because that is where Holly worked whom I loved.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Also, it's icky back there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's true.  People say it's icky.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Okay, I have to go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: David, wait.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Is there no way we can get rid of him?

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Not without cause, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I have cause.  It is be-cause I hate him.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: You have to get along with Toby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Goodbye, Michael. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [Dwight comes over, starts to massage Michael's shoulders] Don't do that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [pours something from the fridge into a bowl and opens the microwave, it is covered in exploded food] Oh, come on! [to the documentary crew] Do you see this?  Disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: So, Tunes, you still gonna buy your old man's place?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, I am.  Wait, how do you know that?  I didn't tell you that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ehhh no, I was just walking by your desk.  I saw some email.  I got peepers of an eagle.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's really not cool.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Kaaw!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: So Jim, you're gonna live in the same house that you used to pee the bed in?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, I guess technically Kev, you're right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Today's a big day.  Today's the day that I show Pam the house that I bought for us. Without telling her. But it's my parent's house, the house I grew up in and yeah, I bought it kind of impulsively. I mean, the price was good and I was helping out my mom.  It's got shag carpets.  I mean you can't blame my parents it was the 70's.  And why would you want to buy ugly wood from trees when you can have paneling? And a painting of some creepy clowns that is apparently crucial to the structural integrity of the building. [tugs and pulls in vain at the clown painting]  She's gonna love it.  Right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Could you guys all do me a favor and not talk about this until I tell Pam?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Whoa, you haven't told the misses about the castle?  You're in for a spanking my friend.  Myself and my lady? - no secrets.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Jim, don't listen to Andy.  I think it's so romantic.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh thanks, Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Where's your place?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, it's on uh Linden Ave?  By the quarry?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Ohhh...

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Cool beans, man, I live by the quarry.  We should hang out by the quarry and throw things down there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Definitely we should.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [reading from a note on the microwave] "To whoever made the microwave mess: the microwave is a shared kitchen appliance.  By not cleaning it up you are basically telling whoever follows that their time is less valuable, as they will have to scrub out your disgusting splatter.  Sincerely, disappointed."

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That is just obnoxious.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: No kidding.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.  Wait, what, the mess or the note?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: The note.  So "holier than thou".

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Hmm, I liked it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Don't you think the person who left the mess is the obnoxious one?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No, the note is way more obnoxious than the mess.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Sincerely, disappointed? Get off your high horse, Richie.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Just because someone likes things clean, doesn't mean they're rich.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Yeh, they're rich.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You want to see some really high caliber acting?  Well, Mr. Kurt Russell, you are about to be served. [walks to the annex] Hey Toby, great to have you back, man.  Seriously, just a, just a real pleasure to see you again.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well thanks Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You're welcome.  Missed you.  Missed you as part of our family.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well that's sweet, I missed you guys too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So Costa Rica that was - did you have fun?  That must have been fun.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well, um, it was amazing.  It really was, thanks for asking.  Um the beaches were pristine...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Nice beaches, pristine beaches?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: ...and, yeah, the whole thing was incredibly cathartic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why'd you come back?  Why didn't you stay?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: It was actually kind of hard to meet people I found.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I bet, for you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: And uh, yeah, plus it was hot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [shifting uncomfortably and sweating] Shhh hot, why didn't you get an air-condition--- should have gotten an air-conditioner for yourself.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Are you all right, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, I am.  I am.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I tried, I tried.  I tried to talk to Toby and be his friend but that is like trying to be friends with an evil... snail.  I feel like I'm dying inside.  I feel like Neve Campbell in Sream II.  She thinks she can go off to college and be happy and then, the murderer comes back and starts killing off all of her friends.  I learned a lot of lessons from that movie, this is just one of them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, just summarize.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, fireable offenses include: workplace violence and sexual harassment.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's it, that's it, perfect.  We will get him to hit on somebody, and then we will catch him in the act.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I love catching people in the act.  That's why I always whip open doors.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mm.  Me too.  Okay, let's get this started.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay [stands up removes jacket and starts loosening his tie]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [removes glasses] I am the bait.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: For what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Men find me desirable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, it's a good day too. I'm wearing my mustard shirt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You're the bait for Toby?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, for one thing, he's not gay.  And if somebody were to be bait it would be Jim.  Or Ryan.  Or me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Men find me desirable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, sure they do, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: When it comes down to it, it's a health issue.  I should have written that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mmhmm, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [looks up] Why aren't you as mad or interested in this as me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh totally.  Sorry, are we talking about the microwave still?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Are you inching away from me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Reach your arms out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [laughs and swings his arm out which doesn't come close to touching the reception desk] I'm always this close.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Pamtown lady sing this song, doo-dah doo-dah.  Hello, Pam.  Jim may I have a moment with Pam please.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes, I just have to take this call anyway so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, oooh his mistress.  No. I'm kidding.  No one would ever cheat on you; you are the complete package, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What do you need, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, what I would like you to do is take this folded note, and deliver it to Toby Flenderson?  I just want you to just react to whatever this note elicits.  Do not read it beforehand.  Can you do that for me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Good. [Pam stands up and starts reading note] N-no no no, don't.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: "Please hug and kiss me, no matter how hard I struggle.  I'm too shy to tell you that I love you."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Pam.  Pam, you gave me your word.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [kissing Kelly against her desk] You did that for me?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Are you happy you did?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey guys that's really inappropriate.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [kisses for a little longer]  What's up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Um, I got some photos from Costa Rica if you want to see them?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yeah, yeah I'll see them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Toby can I see those? Ooh. [takes photos and throws them on the floor] What's the matter?  What's the matter? You scared?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Those are fighting words.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You mad? You mad at me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I hope he doesn't haul off and just hit you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do you want to do that?  You want to hit me, you want to punch me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hmmm?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Huh?  He might do it...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Punch him, Toby!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I dare you to.  Come on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Come on. [making karate moves] Baaah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What's the matter... haaaww!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hit him!  Hit him, Chicken.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yeah, punch him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey hey! Come on, Ryan, who's side are you on?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ryan.  Come on, man?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No do it, do it.  I dare you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Punch him as hard as you possibly can in the face.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Not, not as hard as you can, just a good, solid punch.  Come on! Come oooon...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I'm not going to punch you, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Are you really not going to punch him?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: No, why would I punch you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Son of a bitch.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [as Toby picks up his photos] You should have hit him man, guy was asking for it.  Once in a lifetime, man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I thought you were going to parcel those out through the day

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [mouth full of brownie] Just stop it.  You haven't done anything helpful all day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: There's still one thing we could do to get Toby fired.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [goes over and closes office door] Frame him, for using drugs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Frame him?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, it's illegal, but... everything they do on The Shield is illegal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I've never framed a man before, have you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh I've framed animals before.  I framed a raccoon for opening a Christmas present.  And I framed a bear for eating out of the garbage.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Just seems awfully mean.  But sometimes the ends justify the mean.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hello.  I've seen you guys around.  I'm Michael Scott, Dunder Mifflin.   How you doing?  [they stare at him] Uhghh, so I guess you know why I'm here?  I need to purchase something.

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration guy
quotes.line: A fridge?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. Uh, I wanted--- I wanted to buy some weed? Some...

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration guy
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Grass, weed?

quotes.speaker: Leo
quotes.line: What makes you think we'd have weed?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I heard you drug---  I heard you dealt.

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Guy
quotes.line: [whispers in Leo's ear] Hey, just hold on one second.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm not wearing a wire, so...

quotes.speaker: Leo
quotes.line: Why would you even say that?

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Guy
quotes.line: [comes back up to Michael] Hey, that's gonna be 500 dollars.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How much? How many pounds is it?

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Guy
quotes.line: It's- it's two pounds.  I'm losing money on this man just, give me the money.  Alright, walk away.

quotes.speaker: Leo
quotes.line: Walk away.

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Guy
quotes.line: Walk away.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Hey, Pam?  I just wanted to let you know; I'm totally on your side with the whole microwave situation.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I was just back there, to make some cup-o-soup; the thing is still a huge mess.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I know, can you believe it?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yeah, it's crazy.  But, I guess the thing is at some point, notes or no notes, someone's gonna have to just get there and clean it up.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I guess that's why we have a temp, huh?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Ah ha ha, oh no, trust me.  I would just make it worse.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: How would wiping it with a paper towel make it worse?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I--- I would find a way.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You've seen things cleaned before though, right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I--- Pam, I am hopeless at that stuff I... I, uh...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Hi, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, hey, hey.  Hey.  I forgot... I forgot...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [on a cell phone in the hallway] Yes, I repeat a drug dealer is on the premisis of Dunder Mifflin.  His name is Toby Flenderson [Michael opens Toby's desk drawer and puts something in it] and he recently returned from a mysterious vacation in Central America.   I have risked a great deal to tell you this information.  My name is Andy Bernard.  Andrew Bernard, that's my name.  See you soon.

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 1
quotes.line: Hi, we received a call?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't know anything about that.

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 1
quotes.line: We were tipped off about a possible narcotics situation.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey, Pam. Hey I got this, okay?  Hello, officers, Dwight Schrute, former volunteer Sheriff's Deputy.  Listen, I may have inside information that someone is hiding drugs in this very office.  [leads them back towards the annex as Creed stands up and starts to put him hands up and then relaxes them behind his ears]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Just pretend like we're talking until the cops leave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Those are real cops, real guns.  I wonder what's going on. [follows them]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Officers, I reveal to you the perpetrator.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey, what is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Search his things.

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 2
quotes.line: Sir, can you step away from your desk please?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Why?

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 2
quotes.line: Sir, please step away from your desk.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey, what's going on?  You don't have my permission to do this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: They don't need your permission, Flenderson, they've got the company's permission.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey, hey what are- why are you doing this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh, you know what?  I think that this... uh, this is probably a misunderstanding.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Don't search my stuff.

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 1
quotes.line: Sir?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I have a reasonable right to privacy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Save your whining for the jury there, Flenderson.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, let's just cancel this, okay?

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 1
quotes.line: Sir, did you recently return from a trip to Central America?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no no no... No, no.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: That was... I went to Costa Rica for a few months.  What is going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, that was... that was legitimate.  That was totally legitimate.

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 1
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 2
quotes.line: Check this out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh God!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: That is not mine.  I have never seen that before.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no no no no.

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 1
quotes.line: Turn around.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: What is going on here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: God! No, that's not... I don't know what that is.  And I... I bet he has nothing to do with that!

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 1
quotes.line: Do you have any weapons?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Of course not!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ahh, that's mine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No! Michael, no!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, it's mine.

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 2
quotes.line: Some basil.  Salad dressing, I think.

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 1
quotes.line: Salad dressing?

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 2
quotes.line: Yeah it's, uh, a caprese salad.  There's a little bit of, uh, mozerella right there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Are you kidding me?  That's my salad.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So wait a minute, there's no drugs?

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 2
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Gahh, dammit! [punches file cabinet] Come on!

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 1
quotes.line: We got a fake tip.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wait, officers, are you sure you don't want to interrogate him?

quotes.speaker: Police Officer 1
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [following them out] You have laws that protect you in any kind of interrogation.  Why don't you use them?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You must feel pretty good about yourself right now.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I didn't put caprese salad in my drawer, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Did you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Since when is it illegal to put caprese salad... anywhere.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: You know but the police could have been out there you know, catching real criminals instead of here searching my stuff.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Are you kidding me?  Are you kidding me, that's who you're worried about?  You're... you're worried about the cop's time?  You think I framed you, and you're worried about the taxpayer?  Dah, God! Welcome back, jerky jerk-face.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You said you were leaving and you made liars out of all of us.  So...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I did leave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, you did.  And then you came back, which makes you the biggest liar of... history.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well, I don't see it that way.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do you want to hear a lie?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I think you're great.  You're my best friend.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [stops kissing Kelly] I can't do this.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Can't do what?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: It's not fair to you.  And it's really not fair to me.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Wait, what are you saying?  I broke up with Darryl so I could be with you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: That was your choice; don't put that on me.  I'm just going on a little trip.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Oh, can I come?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: It's not that kind of trip.  I'm going to Thailand with some friends from high school, well, a high school.  And if I don't do it now I'll never get to go.  And I'll always resent you for it... you don't want me to resent you, do you?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: So you're dumping me?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Let's be adults about this.  Let's have sex one more time.  And if you have any extra cash, that would be amazing.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Okay?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [walking out of the building] Hey, do you mind if we make a stop on the way home?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [getting out of the car] What are we doing at your parent's house?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I have a surprise for you.  All right, ready?  Close your eyes and now [spins her around once] open your eyes.  Tadah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't get it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I bought it.  It's ours.  Let's go inside, I'll show you inside.  [walking inside] So if you can believe it I did it without a realtor.  Saving on closing costs is good and, uh, we can put all the money to de-shag the carpet.  Which I think will help, the color situation. [Pam walks over to the clown painting on the wall]  Yeah, I am really sorry about this.  I tried to move it but he is really nailed in there.  Worried about art theft, I guess, lot of art theives in this neighborhood.  [upstairs] This is the master bedroom but, I'm actually not allowed in here so... [shuts the door]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [outside] So I'm still in the process of converting the garage.  It's got great light in here and I'm thinking, it could be perfect [opens garage door] for an art studio.  [Pam looks around and then looks at him] Look, I know, I bought this without asking you and it's doesn't look great, I know that.  And if you really hate it, I totally understand it's just---

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I love it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You do?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, I love it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I mean, you bought me a house!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh my God...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You bought me a house!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, I did. [they kiss]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Um, do we have to sleep in your parent's bedroom?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, No, we'll just board that up.  It'll be that weird spare room that people ask us about.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: And the clown?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, I can't... really can't move him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What is my perfect crime?  I break into Tiffany's at midnight.  Do I go for the vault? No, I go for the chandelier.  It's priceless.  As I'm taking it down, a woman catches me.  She tells me to stop.  It's her father's business.  She's Tiffany.  I say no.  We make love all night.  In the morning the cops come and I escape in one of their uniforms.  I tell her to meet me in Mexico but I go to Canada.  I don't trust her.  Besides, I like the cold.  Thirty years later, I get a postcard.  I have a son and he's the chief of police.  This is where the story gets interesting: I tell Tiffany to meet me in Paris, by the Trocadero.  She's been waiting for me all these years; she's never taken another lover.  I don't care, I don't show up. I go to Berlin.  That's where I stashed the chandelier.
